intro: Pimpinella enguezekensis, commonly known as the Enguezek's parsley, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, celery, and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and calcareous soils, thriving in mountainous regions. It has slender stems and bipinnate leaves that are finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
